definition: to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao

sentences.english: Always thought that to understand a lot of their own, chat all day, pretend to be thou.
sentences.chinese: 總以爲自己懂很多，整天談天說地，自命清高。

sentences.english: His loftiness sends him into despair when deprived of his job.
sentences.chinese: 他的自命清高使他在下崗後陷入絕望的境地。

sentences.english: Our response to profanity and unacceptable speech should not be an occasion for self-righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 我們在對粗俗話語的反應不可自命清高。

to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to be cynical/to be embittered
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
pedantic/trite/inflexible/adherence to old ideas
snob
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to despise/to scorn
arrogant and conceited
to disdain/to loathe
sanctimonious/dignified
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
